Text: Over there! That's him...
You're kidding! He's super average...
This must be some kind of mix-up...
I'll kill him! Wait, who even is he?
*sigh*...
It's weird, right?
Bizarre.
Absolutely bonkers.

(It's the next day. I'm having lunch in the cafeteria
and just told my two friends about yesterday. The
three of us are all in agreementâ€”there's definitely
something strange going on.)

No offense, but Princess Alexia is way out of your
league.

If she said yes to me? I'd still think it was fishy.
Right?

(That's Skel, the second son of the Baron Etal. He's
slim and tall, and though it seems he cares about
his outer appearance, he has zero style.)

(If you look at him from far away, he could trick you
into thinking he's hot. Erm, maybe not. I take that
back.)

(Either way, Princess Alexia is way out of Skel
Etal's league, too.)

(I know this for a fact because I consider him my
"minor character" friend.)

If Cid's good enough for her, I bet I would've been
good enough, too. Gah, I really should have
confessed to her earlier.

(That's Po, the second son of the Baron Tato. He's
short and somewhat stocky. You know how there's
one potato-esque guy on every baseball team?
That's basically him.)

(It doesn't matter if you look at him from afar, from
up close, or from any other angle. With his looks, he
could never scam anyone into thinking he's cool.)

(It goes without saying that he has absolutely no
chance with Princess Alexia. After all, he's a
pure background character.)
(Oh, and by the way, my name's Cid.)

(When I'm playing the part of Cid Kagenou, I'm also
playing the part of your average Joe.)

Honestly, it's terrible. I have a feeling she's got
an ulterior motive which freaks me out. Plus,
we basically live in two totally different worlds.

Yeah, I hear you. And unlike me, you're not blessed
in the looks department. I'd give it a week before
she calls it quits.
Three days. Just look around you.

I scan the cafeteria and see everyone whispering and
observing me.
You're kidding! He's average...
This must be some kind of mix-up...
Oh, I think he's pretty cute...
No way!
(Et cetera.)

I heard he blackmailed her... That's what Skel Etal
said.
Iâ€™ll kill him in his sleep...
Make it look like an accident during practice...
If I don't do it now, I'll bring shame to humanity...
(Et cetera.)

(I've got pretty good ears, so I hear almost all
their chatter. I take a moment to glare at Skel.)

(I guess friendships between minor characters can be
fickle and fleeting.)
Hmm? What's up?
Nothing.

But seriously, what do I do? It'd be weird if I
mention breaking up after I just confessed
to her.

(And it would break character to dump a princessâ€”
though I guess people in this role wouldn't date one
in the first place.)

Come on, give it a try. If you're lucky, you might
make some nice memories.
(Skel has a sly grin on his face.)

He's right. Let's say this is all a misunderstanding.
You still get to date a princess. Don't waste your
time dealing with bullies.
Or I can trade places with you if you want...
It doesn't work that way.

(Even as we waste time now, rumors about me will
continue to circulate around the schoolâ€”meaning
I'm getting pushed further and further away from
my existence as an average nobody.)

But now that you two are actually going out, you've
gotta stay quiet about losing that penalty game.
(Po muses.)

Yeah. I can see things getting messy if word got out.
Please don't say anything. I'm looking at you, Skel.
Me? I'd never say anything!
My lips are sealed as well, of course.
I'm serious.

(I sigh as I reach for my daily lunch for broke
aristocratsâ€”which costs exactly 980 zeni.)

(I'm starting to get annoyed by the vibe of this
place. I'm just going to eat lunch as quickly as
possible and skedaddle out of here.)
(Just then, Po lets out a startled cry.)

(I turn to see the exact person we've been
discussing.)
Is this seat available?
(Enter Princess Alexia.)

(Ugh, I knew she was here. That's why I was trying to
scarf down my lunch.)
P-P-Pwease do!
Y-Y-You can sit here! It's our pleasure!

(These are the same guys who were talking big game
about how they could date her if they wanted to.)

(They've now responded by basically shriveling into
nothing. Yep, just as expected of my friends.)
Yeah, sure. Go ahead.

(I say to Princess Alexia, who's waiting for my
answer.)
Don't mind if I do.
(She replies, taking a seat.)
Sitting next to a low-ranking aristocrat?!
Then the rumors are true. They're actually dating!
They're sitting so close to each other!

(I ignore the chatter my trained ears pick up
throughout the cafeteria.)
Nice weather we're having.
(It seems like an obvious way to fill the silence.)
Indeed.
(Our innocuous conversation continues.)

(A group of maids set the lunch course of the super-
duper filthy richâ€”which costs a whopping ten
thousand zeniâ€”at the seat next to me with
marked efficiency.)

(With an elegant move of her hand, Princess Alexia
starts eating her extravagant lunch. Her manners
are impeccable.)

(Us low-rank nobles really are just a hair above
commoners in comparison.)

Oh, don't worry about being polite here. I mean, this
is the section for low-ranking aristocrats.
Wow, you royals sure get served a lot of food.
Yeah. I can never finish it.
What a waste.

I would be fine buying a cheaper lunch, but if I
don't get the expensive one, others might
refuse it too in order to curry favor.
In that case, can I eat your leftovers?
Yes, but...

(Alexia looks baffled as I swipe the meat from her
main dish and cram it into my mouth,)
(before she can get a word in edgewise.)
Oh, it's good.
Whaaa...?!
Pass the fish.
Wonder how the dessert tastes.
Yeah, that's super good!

(Whoo-hoo, it's my lucky day. Thanks to the princess,
I get to fill my stomach which is blissed the hell out.)

(My attitude toward her has changed from yesterday
and I'm acting super-casual around her.)

(Because I'm in the middle of Operation: Get
Dumped ASAP!)

(Soon I'll be back to living my best side character
life.)
(Seen enough, princess?)

(Just as I think this, I'm unceremoniously
interrupted by Alexia.)

I assume you're taking Royal Bushin for your
practical elective in the afternoon.
Uh...yeah.

I'm in that class, too. I thought it'd be nice to
take it together.

Yeah, but we can't. I mean, you're in section one.
I'm in section nine.

(The academy requires its students to take general
courses in the morning and practical electives in the
afternoon. The former takes place in set classrooms,)

(but the latter is a mishmash of students from all
classes and grades. We're basically allowed to
choose one of many weapon arts electives that
we feel suits us best.)

(Bushin Arts class is so popular that it has nine
different sections with fifty students in each,
divided up by skill level.)

(For now, I'm performing poorly enough to be in
section nine, so I can scope things out. I plan to
eventually settle for section five.)
No, it's okay.
With my recommendation, I got you into section one.
...It's totally not okay. I know that for a fact.
Would you rather that I enroll in section nine?
No, stop. That'd make me look bad.
It's one or the other. Choose.
No.
This is a royal order.
...Fine.
(I mumble obediently.)

(With that, lunch is over and "Operation: Get
Dumped ASAP!" is over too.)

(Skel and Po were completely still from start to
finish, basically melting into the background.)
This place is huge...

(I marvel the moment I step into the classroom for
section one. I can't help myself.)

(It looks like a gigantic gymnasium. In addition to a
locker room, it is fully equipped with a shower room,
a cafe, and a maid who opens the entrance, which
makes it a manually operated automatic door, I guess.

(As for section nine, we meet outdoorsâ€”rain or shine,
sleet or snow. There isn't even a door for a maid to
open, much less a maid.)
Starting today, we have a new friend joining us.
(Our instructor starts, introducing me.)
I'm Cid Kagenou. It's nice to meet you.

(There isn't a hint of friendliness in my classmates'
eyes.)

(Ah, section one. There's a tenseness in the air
unlike in section nine.)

(A quick glance around, and I can already spot some
VIPs. That hot guy over there is the second son of a
duke,)

(and that beauty is the daughter of the current
leader of the Dark Knights. Then there's our teacher
Zenon, who's the fencing instructor for the country.)

(And on top of that, he's a young blonde hunk who's
only twenty-eight years old.)

As you know, the Royal Bushin method is a relatively
new fighting style, a deviation from traditional
Bushin...
It's the new kid on the block, just like you, Cid.

There was some resistance at first between the
traditional supporters and the trailblazers. But
thanks to Princess Iris,

it's now being recognized as the artistic heir of its
traditional counterpart.

You see, with enough power, you can always prove the
naysayers wrong.
So, tell me, how much power do you have?

I hear you're one of the swordsmen who's spread the
art throughout the country, sir.

Yes, but my contributions are nothing compared to
Princess Iris. In any case, the Royal Bushin method
practically raised me.

Which is why it makes me happy to see others enjoying
it, too.
...Oh, pardon me. I didn't mean to interrupt you.

With that, Mr. Zenon goes to check in on the other
students.
